unnormalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gains Momentum in Maharashtra**
normalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gains Momentum in Maharashtra**

unnormalised: Mumbai, Maharashtra - The Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Co. Ltd (MSEDCL) announced significant progress in its smart meter implementation program today, 12/10/2023. The initiative, aimed at improving billing accuracy and reducing power theft, has seen over 50,000 smart meters installed in Pune and Nagpur since the project's commencement in July 2023.
normalised: Mumbai, Maharashtra - The Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited (M S E D C L) announced significant progress in its smart meter implementation program today, twelfth october two thousand and twenty three. The initiative, aimed at improving billing accuracy and reducing power theft, has seen over fifty thousand smart meters installed in Pune and Nagpur since the project's commencement in July two thousand and twenty three.

unnormalised: "This is a crucial step towards modernizing our power distribution infrastructure," stated Mr. Deshmukh, Chairman of MSEDCL, during a press briefing at 11:00 hrs. "Smart meters empower consumers with real-time energy consumption data, allowing them to make informed decisions and conserve electricity. We anticipate a statewide rollout by December 2024."
normalised: "This is a crucial step towards modernizing our power distribution infrastructure," stated Mister Deshmukh, Chairman of M S E D C L, during a press briefing at eleven o'clock. "Smart meters empower consumers with real-time energy consumption data, allowing them to make informed decisions and conserve electricity. We anticipate a statewide rollout by December two thousand and twenty four."

unnormalised: The advanced metering infrastructure (AMI) also enables remote meter reading and automated outage detection, significantly reducing response times during power failures. MSEDCL projects a reduction in aggregate technical and commercial (AT&C) losses by at least 15% after the complete implementation. The next phase will focus on rural electrification areas, starting on 15/11/2023, bringing the benefits of smart metering even to remote villages like those near Nashik.
normalised: The advanced metering infrastructure (A M I) also enables remote meter reading and automated outage detection, significantly reducing response times during power failures. M S E D C L projects a reduction in aggregate technical and commercial (A T and C) losses by at least fifteen percent after the complete implementation. The next phase will focus on rural electrification areas, starting on fifteenth november two thousand and twenty three, bringing the benefits of smart metering even to remote villages like those near Nashik.
